summary: Johanna Lynn Smith was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents provide her name and indicate she was employed by the committee during these periods. The documents list her as an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations, and include her name in payroll certifications and certification reports.
significance: Johanna Lynn Smith's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the documents do not specify her role, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates she was part of the committee's staff during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
